intro: Cystium merrillii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and lobed leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Cystium merrillii is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of Hawaii and is considered an endemic species.
